page.title: 03MENDLESHAM CHURCH
page.content: There has been a church in Mendlesham since 1060 and the oldest part of the present church was built in 1200. It is built from flint and stone. It has a high, square tower with four bells. Mendlesham has an armoury. It is in a little room over the porch which is 500 years old. It has some armour leg and body pieces and some helmets. There are also three chests, part of a long bow and many other interesting things. Inside the church it is painted white but many years ago the walls had pictures painted on them. There are some carved wooden bench ends. There is also nice carving on the pulpit and over the font. The church has a vinegar bible and there are two funeral biers. Set on the floor is a brass figure of John Knyvet.
